app.routes package¶

Submodules¶

app.routes.customers module¶

This module defines the Customer Service, which manages customer accounts, including registration, authentication, wallet transactions, and CRUD operations.

Endpoints:

  • /login: Authenticate a customer and return a JWT token.

  • /register: Register a new customer account.

  • /: Retrieve a list of all customers.

  • /<username>: Retrieve, update, or delete a specific customer by username.

  • /<username>/charge: Add funds to a customer’s wallet.

  • /<username>/deduct: Deduct funds from a customer’s wallet.

  • /health: Perform a health check for the Customer Service.

app.routes.customers.charge_wallet(username)[source]¶

Add funds to a customer’s wallet.

Path Parameters:

  • username (str): The username of the customer.

Request Body:

  • amount (float): The amount to add to the wallet.

Returns:

A success message with the new wallet balance. - 404: An error message if the customer is not found.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.customers.customer_health_check()[source]¶

Check if the Customer Service is healthy.

Returns:

A success message if the service is healthy. - 500: An error message if there is an issue.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.customers.deduct_wallet(username)[source]¶

Deduct funds from a customer’s wallet.

Path Parameters:

  • username (str): The username of the customer.

Request Body:

  • amount (float): The amount to deduct from the wallet.

Returns:

A success message with the new wallet balance. - 404: An error message if the customer is not found. - 400: An error message if the balance is insufficient.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.customers.delete_customer(username)[source]¶

Delete a specific customer by username.

Path Parameters:

  • username (str): The username of the customer.

Returns:

A success message if the deletion is successful. - 404: An error message if the customer is not found.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.customers.get_all_customers()[source]¶

Retrieve a list of all customers.

Returns:

A list of all customers with basic details.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.customers.get_customer(username)[source]¶

Retrieve details of a specific customer by username.

Path Parameters:

  • username (str): The username of the customer.

Returns:

Customer details if the customer exists. - 404: An error message if the customer is not found.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.customers.login()[source]¶

Authenticate a customer and return a JWT token.

Request Body:

  • username (str): The username of the customer.

  • password (str): The password of the customer.

Returns:

A JWT token if authentication is successful. - 401: An error message if authentication fails.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.customers.register_customer()[source]¶

Register a new customer account.

Request Body:

  • full_name (str): Full name of the customer.

  • username (str): Unique username for the customer.

  • password (str): Password for the customer.

  • age (int): Age of the customer.

  • address (str): Address of the customer.

  • gender (str): Gender of the customer.

  • marital_status (str): Marital status of the customer.

Returns:

A success message if the registration is successful. - 400: An error message if the username is already taken.

Return type:

  • 201

app.routes.customers.update_customer(username)[source]¶

Update the details of a specific customer by username.

Path Parameters:

  • username (str): The username of the customer.

Request Body:

  • Fields to update (e.g., full_name, address, wallet_balance, etc.).

Returns:

A success message if the update is successful. - 404: An error message if the customer is not found.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.inventory module¶

This module defines the Inventory Service, which manages inventory items, including adding, deducting, updating stock, and performing health checks.

Endpoints:

  • /: Add new goods to the inventory.

  • /deduct: Deduct stock from existing goods in the inventory.

  • /<item_id>: Update details of a specific inventory item.

  • /health: Perform a health check for the Inventory Service.

app.routes.inventory.add_goods()[source]¶

Add new goods to the inventory.

Request Body:

  • name (str): Name of the item.

  • category (str): Category of the item.

  • pricePerItem (float): Price per unit of the item.

  • description (str): Description of the item.

  • countInStock (int): Quantity of the item in stock.

Returns:

A success message with the item ID and name.

Return type:

  • 201

app.routes.inventory.deduct_goods()[source]¶

Deduct stock from an existing inventory item.

Request Body:

  • itemId (int): ID of the item to deduct stock from.

  • quantity (int): Quantity to deduct.

Returns:

A success message with the updated stock count. - 404: An error message if the item is not found. - 400: An error message if the stock is insufficient.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.inventory.inventory_health_check()[source]¶

Check if the Inventory Service is healthy.

Returns:

A success message if the service is healthy. - 500: An error message if there is an issue.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.inventory.update_goods(item_id)[source]¶

Update details of an existing inventory item.

Path Parameters:

  • item_id (int): ID of the item to update.

Request Body:

  • name (str, optional): Updated name of the item.

  • category (str, optional): Updated category of the item.

  • pricePerItem (float, optional): Updated price per unit.

  • description (str, optional): Updated description.

  • countInStock (int, optional): Updated stock quantity.

Returns:

A success message with the updated item details. - 404: An error message if the item is not found.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.review module¶

This module defines the Review Service, which manages operations related to product reviews, including creating, updating, deleting, and fetching reviews.

Endpoints:

  • /: Submit a new review.

  • /<review_id>: Update or delete a review.

  • /product/<product_id>: Get all reviews for a specific product.

  • /user/<user_id>: Get all reviews submitted by a specific user.

  • /health: Perform a health check for the Review Service.

app.routes.review.delete_review(review_id)[source]¶

Delete a review. Only the review’s author can delete it.

Path Parameters:

  • review_id (int): ID of the review to delete.

Returns:

Success message if the review is deleted. - 403: Error message if the user is unauthorized to delete the review.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.review.get_product_reviews(product_id)[source]¶

Get all reviews for a specific product.

Path Parameters:

  • product_id (int): ID of the product.

Returns:

A list of reviews for the product. - []: An empty list if no reviews are found.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.review.get_user_reviews(user_id)[source]¶

Get all reviews submitted by a specific user.

Path Parameters:

  • user_id (int): ID of the user.

Returns:

A list of reviews submitted by the user.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.review.review_health_check()[source]¶

Check if the Review Service is healthy.

Returns:

A success message if the service is healthy. - 500: An error message if there is an issue.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.review.submit_review()[source]¶

Submit a new review for a product.

Request Body:

  • product_id (int): ID of the product being reviewed.

  • user_id (int): ID of the user submitting the review.

  • rating (int): Rating given to the product (1-5).

  • comment (str, optional): Review comment.

Returns:

Success message with the review ID. - 400: Validation error message if input data is invalid.

Return type:

  • 201

app.routes.review.update_review(review_id)[source]¶

Update an existing review.

Path Parameters:

  • review_id (int): ID of the review to update.

Request Body:

  • rating (int, optional): Updated rating (1-5).

  • comment (str, optional): Updated comment.

Returns:

Success message with updated review details. - 404: Error message if the review is not found. - 400: Error message if an exception occurs during the update.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.sales module¶

This module defines the Sales Service, which manages operations related to product sales, including browsing goods, making purchases, and viewing purchase history.

Endpoints:

  • /goods: List all available goods.

  • /goods/<good_name>: Get details about a specific good.

  • /purchase: Make a purchase.

  • /history/<username>: View purchase history for a specific user.

  • /health: Perform a health check for the Sales Service.

app.routes.sales.display_goods()[source]¶

Display all available goods with a rate limit of 10 requests per minute.

Returns:

A list of goods with their name, price, and quantity, only if the quantity is greater than 0.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.sales.get_good_details(good_name)[source]¶

Get details about a specific good.

Path Parameters:

  • good_name (str): Name of the good.

Returns:

Details of the good (id, name, price, quantity). - 404: Error message if the good is not found.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.sales.make_sale()[source]¶

Make a purchase of a good.

Request Body:

  • username (str): Username of the customer making the purchase.

  • good_name (str): Name of the good being purchased.

  • quantity (int, optional): Quantity of the good to purchase (default: 1).

Returns:

Success message with remaining wallet balance. - 404: Error message if the customer or good is not found. - 400: Error message if there is insufficient stock or wallet balance.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.sales.purchase_history(username)[source]¶

Get the purchase history for a specific customer.

Path Parameters:

  • username (str): Username of the customer.

Returns:

A list of purchases including good name, quantity, total price, and timestamp. - 404: Error message if the customer is not found.

Return type:

  • 200

app.routes.sales.sales_health_check()[source]¶

Perform a health check for the Sales Service.

Returns:

Success message if the service is healthy. - 500: Error message if there is an issue.

Return type:

  • 200
